comments:
I had just downloaded eclipse's SDK version 2.0.2 on my XP laptop.

When I try to run eclipse with the -vm option using my JRE 1.3.1 directory, I 
get this message in my log file:

!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Jan 31, 2003 18:31:10.395
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not find bootstrap code. Check location of 
boot plug-in or specify -boot.
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.searchForBoot(Main.java:424)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getBootPath(Main.java:394)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:237)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:703)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:539)

I ran elcipse again using the -boot option and I still get this error log.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 30246 ***

As a test, I tried transfering eclipse.exe over to my Win98 desktop and it ran 
there but not on my XP which I need to do Java Enterprise work on.
Are you running XP and Win98 on the same machine? (e.g. on a shared drive?)

I am running eclipse from two different machines:  The successfui launch of 
eclipse on the Win 98 is from my Dell XPS Dimension 450 MHZ Pentium II 
desktop.  While it is slow due to slower processing speed of the '98 Operating 
system,it does launch

The Machine that eclipse fails toi launch on is the Dell Latitude Laptop which 
is running XP and is pentium III with twice the RAM of my desktop so it should 
lauch rather quickly but it dies with that bootstrap error.

traces.message: Could not find bootstrap code. Check location of  boot plug-in or specify -boot.
